00022 #include "dfsch/lib/threads.h"

00024 #include <dfsch/number.h>

00029 typedef struct thread_obj_t {
00030   dfsch_type_t* type;
00031   pthread_t thread;
00032 } thread_obj_t;
00033 
00034 static int thread_equal_p(thread_obj_t* a, thread_obj_t* b){
00035   return pthread_equal(a->thread, b->thread);
00036 }
00037 
00038 static const dfsch_type_t thread_type = {
00039   DFSCH_STANDARD_TYPE,
00040   NULL,
00041   sizeof(thread_obj_t), 
00042   "thread",
00043   (dfsch_type_equal_p_t)thread_equal_p,
00044   NULL,
00045   NULL
00046 };
00047 
00048 typedef struct thread_args_t {
00049   dfsch_object_t* function;
00050   dfsch_object_t* args;
00051 } thread_args_t;
00052 
00053 dfsch_object_t* thread_function(thread_args_t* args){
00054   return dfsch_apply(args->function, args->args);
00055 }
00056 
00057 dfsch_object_t* dfsch_thread_create(dfsch_object_t* function,
00058                                     dfsch_object_t* arguments){
00059   
00060   thread_obj_t* thread = (thread_obj_t*) dfsch_make_object(&thread_type);
00061   thread_args_t* args = GC_NEW(thread_args_t);
00062   
00063   args->function = function;
00064   args->args = arguments;
00065   
00066   pthread_create(&(thread->thread), 
00067                  NULL, 
00068                  (void*(*)(void*))thread_function, 
00069                  args);
00070 
00071   return (dfsch_object_t*)thread;  
00072 }
00073 
00074 dfsch_object_t* dfsch_thread_join(dfsch_object_t* thread){
00075   thread_obj_t* t;
00076   dfsch_object_t* ret;
00077   int err;
00078   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(thread) != &thread_type)
00079     dfsch_error("thread:not-a-thread", thread);
00080 
00081   t = (thread_obj_t*)thread;
00082 
00083   err = pthread_join(t->thread, (void*)&ret);
00084 
00085   if (err != 0){
00086     dfsch_error("thread:unix-error",dfsch_make_string_cstr(strerror(err)));
00087   }
00088 
00089   return ret;
00090 }
00091 void dfsch_thread_detach(dfsch_object_t* thread){
00092   thread_obj_t* t;
00093   int err;
00094   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(thread) != &thread_type)
00095     dfsch_error("thread:not-a-thread", thread);
00096 
00097   t = (thread_obj_t*)thread;
00098 
00099   err = pthread_detach(t->thread);
00100 
00101   if (err != 0){
00102     dfsch_error("thread:unix-error",dfsch_make_string_cstr(strerror(err)));
00103   }
00104 }
00105 
00106 dfsch_object_t* dfsch_thread_self(){
00107   thread_obj_t* thread = (thread_obj_t*) dfsch_make_object(&thread_type);
00108   
00109   thread->thread = pthread_self();
00110 
00111   return (dfsch_object_t*)thread;
00112 }

00114 // Mutexes
00115 
00116 typedef struct mutex_obj_t {
00117   dfsch_type_t* type;
00118   pthread_mutex_t mutex;
00119 } mutex_obj_t;
00120 
00121 static const dfsch_type_t mutex_type = {
00122   DFSCH_STANDARD_TYPE,
00123   NULL,
00124   sizeof(mutex_obj_t), 
00125   "mutex",
00126   NULL,
00127   NULL,
00128   NULL
00129 };
00130 
00131 static void mutex_finalizer(mutex_obj_t* mutex, void* cd){
00132   /*
00133    * When given mutex is locked we will do nothing. If user loses reference
00134    * to locked mutex, something is probably wrong.
00135    *
00136    * By the way, on LinuxThreads this is nevertheless a little more than 
00137    * no-op, so it probably doesn't matter. (althought some other 
00138    * impementations may leak some resources here)
00139    */
00140 
00141   pthread_mutex_destroy(&(mutex->mutex));
00142 }
00143 
00144 dfsch_object_t* dfsch_mutex_create(){
00145   mutex_obj_t* mutex = (mutex_obj_t*)dfsch_make_object(&mutex_type);
00146 
00147   GC_REGISTER_FINALIZER(mutex, 
00148                         (GC_finalization_proc)mutex_finalizer,
00149                         NULL, NULL, NULL);
00150 
00151   pthread_mutex_init(&(mutex->mutex), NULL);
00152 
00153   return (dfsch_object_t*)mutex;
00154 }
00155 void dfsch_mutex_lock(dfsch_object_t* mutex){
00156   mutex_obj_t* m;
00157   int err;
00158   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(mutex) != &mutex_type)
00159     dfsch_error("thread:not-a-mutex", mutex);
00160 
00161   m = (mutex_obj_t*)mutex;
00162 
00163   err = pthread_mutex_lock(&(m->mutex));
00164 
00165   if (err != 0){
00166     dfsch_error("thread:unix-error",dfsch_make_string_cstr(strerror(err)));
00167   }
00168 }
00169 int dfsch_mutex_trylock(dfsch_object_t* mutex){
00170   mutex_obj_t* m;
00171   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(mutex) != &mutex_type)
00172     dfsch_error("thread:not-a-mutex", mutex);
00173 
00174   m = (mutex_obj_t*)mutex;
00175 
00176   return (pthread_mutex_trylock(&(m->mutex)) == 0);
00177 }
00178 void dfsch_mutex_unlock(dfsch_object_t* mutex){
00179   mutex_obj_t* m;
00180   int err;
00181   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(mutex) != &mutex_type)
00182     dfsch_error("thread:not-a-mutex", mutex);
00183 
00184   m = (mutex_obj_t*)mutex;
00185 
00186   err = pthread_mutex_unlock(&(m->mutex));
00187 
00188   if (err != 0){
00189     dfsch_error("thread:unix-error",dfsch_make_string_cstr(strerror(err)));
00190   }
00191 }

00193 // Condition variables
00194 
00195 typedef struct condition_t {
00196   dfsch_type_t* type;
00197   pthread_cond_t cond;
00198 } condition_t;
00199 
00200 static const dfsch_type_t condition_type = {
00201   DFSCH_STANDARD_TYPE,
00202   NULL,
00203   sizeof(condition_t), 
00204   "condition",
00205   NULL,
00206   NULL,
00207   NULL
00208 };
00209 
00210 static void condition_finalizer(condition_t* cond, void* cd){
00211   /* 
00212    * No-op when there are threads waiting (and associated resource leak 
00213    * somewhere).
00214    */
00215 
00216   pthread_cond_destroy(&(cond->cond));
00217 }
00218 
00219 dfsch_object_t* dfsch_condition_create(){
00220   condition_t* cond = (condition_t*)dfsch_make_object(&condition_type);
00221 
00222   GC_REGISTER_FINALIZER(cond, 
00223                         (GC_finalization_proc)condition_finalizer,
00224                         NULL, NULL, NULL);
00225 
00226   pthread_cond_init(&(cond->cond), NULL);
00227 
00228   return (dfsch_object_t*)cond;
00229 }
00230 
00231 void dfsch_condition_wait(dfsch_object_t* cond, dfsch_object_t* mutex){
00232   condition_t* c;
00233   int err;
00234   mutex_obj_t* m;
00235 
00236   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(mutex) != &mutex_type)
00237     dfsch_error("thread:not-a-mutex", mutex);
00238   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(cond) != &condition_type)
00239     dfsch_error("thread:not-a-condition", cond);
00240 
00241   c = (condition_t*)cond;
00242   m = (mutex_obj_t*)mutex;
00243 
00244   err = pthread_cond_wait(&(c->cond), &(m->mutex));
00245 
00246   if (err != 0){
00247     dfsch_error("thread:unix-error",dfsch_make_string_cstr(strerror(err)));
00248   }
00249 }
00250 
00251 void dfsch_condition_signal(dfsch_object_t* cond){
00252   condition_t* c;
00253   int err;
00254   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(cond) != &condition_type)
00255     dfsch_error("thread:not-a-condition", cond);
00256 
00257   c = (condition_t*)cond;
00258 
00259   err = pthread_cond_signal(&(c->cond));
00260 
00261   if (err != 0){
00262     dfsch_error("thread:unix-error",dfsch_make_string_cstr(strerror(err)));
00263   }
00264 }
00265 
00266 void dfsch_condition_broadcast(dfsch_object_t* cond){
00267   condition_t* c;
00268   int err;
00269   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(cond) != &condition_type)
00270     dfsch_error("thread:not-a-condition", cond);
00271 
00272   c = (condition_t*)cond;
00273 
00274   err = pthread_cond_broadcast(&(c->cond));
00275 
00276   if (err != 0){
00277     dfsch_error("thread:unix-error",dfsch_make_string_cstr(strerror(err)));
00278   }
00279 }
00280 
00281 // Channels
00282 
00283 /*
00284  * Channel is simply inter-thread pipe for transferring objects. In theory,
00285  * it could be possible to use channel as a queue inside one thread - but you
00286  * are risking a deadlock here when channels' buffer becomes full or empty.
00287  */
00288 
00289 typedef struct channel_t {
00290   dfsch_type_t* type;
00291 
00292   pthread_mutex_t* mutex;
00293   pthread_cond_t* read;
00294   pthread_cond_t* write;
00295   
00296   dfsch_object_t** buf;
00297   
00298   size_t buf_len;
00299   size_t readptr;
00300   size_t writeptr;
00301 } channel_t;
00302 
00303 static const dfsch_type_t channel_type = {
00304   DFSCH_STANDARD_TYPE,
00305   NULL,
00306   sizeof(channel_t), 
00307   "channel",
00308   NULL,
00309   NULL,
00310   NULL
00311 };
00312 
00313 dfsch_object_t* dfsch_channel_create(size_t buffer){
00314   channel_t* ch = (channel_t*)dfsch_make_object(&channel_type);
00315 
00316   ch->read = create_finalized_cvar();
00317   ch->write = create_finalized_cvar();
00318   ch->mutex = create_finalized_mutex();
00319 
00320   ch->buf = GC_MALLOC(sizeof(dfsch_object_t*)*buffer);
00321   ch->buf_len = buffer;
00322   ch->readptr = 0;
00323   ch->writeptr = 0;
00324 
00325   return (dfsch_object_t*)ch;
00326 }
00327 
00328 dfsch_object_t* dfsch_channel_read(dfsch_object_t* channel){
00329   channel_t* ch;
00330   dfsch_object_t* ret;
00331 
00332   /*
00333    * pthread functions returning errors here probably means that something is 
00334    * fundamentaly wrong, so we don't bother to check for them.
00335    */
00336 
00337   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(channel) != &channel_type)
00338     dfsch_error("thread:not-a-channel", channel);
00339   
00340   ch = (channel_t*) channel;
00341 
00342   pthread_mutex_lock(ch->mutex);
00343   
00344   while(ch->readptr == ch->writeptr){ // Buffer is empty
00345     pthread_cond_wait(ch->read, ch->mutex);
00346   }
00347 
00348   ret = ch->buf[ch->readptr];
00349   ch->buf[ch->readptr] = NULL;
00350   ch->readptr = (ch->readptr + 1) % ch->buf_len;
00351 
00352   pthread_mutex_unlock(ch->mutex);
00353   pthread_cond_signal(ch->write);
00354 
00355   return ret;
00356 }
00357 
00358 void dfsch_channel_write(dfsch_object_t* channel,
00359                          dfsch_object_t* object){
00360   channel_t* ch;
00361   size_t new_writeptr;
00362 
00363   /*
00364    * pthread functions returning errors here probably means that something is 
00365    * fundamentaly wrong, so we don't bother to check for them.
00366    */
00367 
00368   if (DFSCH_TYPE_OF(channel) != &channel_type)
00369     dfsch_error("thread:not-a-channel", channel);
00370   
00371   ch = (channel_t*) channel;
00372 
00373   pthread_mutex_lock(ch->mutex);
00374   
00375   new_writeptr = (ch->writeptr + 1) % ch->buf_len;
00376 
00377   while(ch->readptr == new_writeptr){ // Buffer is full
00378     pthread_cond_wait(ch->write, ch->mutex);
00379   }
00380 
00381   ch->buf[ch->writeptr] = object;
00382   ch->writeptr = new_writeptr;
00383 
00384   pthread_mutex_unlock(ch->mutex);
00385   pthread_cond_signal(ch->read);
00386 
00387 }
